author: Susan Delson
title: An Avant-Garde Director’s Take on Chinese Treasures
text:
Next weekend in Minneapolis, visitors can take on the roaring spectacle and thudding body contact of the Super Bowl—or listen to a single chopstick drop into a darkened room, courtesy of an avant-garde director offering a unique look at classic Chinese culture.

“Power and Beauty in China’s Last Dynasty: Concept and Design by Robert Wilson” will open Saturday at the Minneapolis Institute of Art (Mia). Midwesterners hungry for more Chinese art can travel later in February to the Art Institute of Chicago, for an exhibition focusing... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
